briefdescription.para: Application id (usually matches your bots id)
Context menu type, defaults to dpp::ctxm_chat_input.
Command name (1-32 chars)
Command description (1-100 chars)
Command options (parameters)
Whether the command is enabled by default when the app is added to a guild. This has no effect as the default_member_permissions value is used instead.

xrefdescription.para: Discord discourage use of this value and instead you should use slashcommand::default_member_permissions.

briefdescription.para: command permissions

xrefdescription.para: Discord discourage use of this value and instead you should use default_member_permissions.

briefdescription.para: autoincrementing version identifier updated during substantial record changes
Localisations of command name.
Localisations of command description.
The default permissions of this command on a guild. D++ defaults this to dpp::p_use_application_commands.

simplesect.para: You can set it to 0 to disable the command for everyone except admins by default

briefdescription.para: True if this command should be allowed in a DM D++ defaults this to false. Cannot be set to true in a guild command, only a global command.
Indicates whether the command is age-restricted. Defaults to false.
Unique ID of object set by Discord. This value contains a timestamp, worker ID, internal server ID, and an incrementing value. Only the timestamp is relevant to us as useful metadata.
Fill object properties from JSON.

simplesect.para: slashcommand& Reference to self

briefdescription.para: Build a json for this object.

parameterdescription.para: True if to include the ID in the JSON

simplesect.para: json JSON object

briefdescription.para: Construct a new slashcommand object.
Construct a new slashcommand object.

parameterdescription.para: Application id (usually the bot's user id)

briefdescription.para: Construct a new slashcommand object.

parameterdescription.para: Application id (usually the bot's user id)

briefdescription.para: Destroy the slashcommand object.
Add a localisation for this slash command.

parameterdescription.para: Name of language, see the list of locales linked to above
name of slash command in the specified language
description of slash command in the specified language (optional)

simplesect.para: slashcommand& reference to self for chaining of calls

briefdescription.para: Set the dm permission for the command.

parameterdescription.para: true to allow this command in dms

simplesect.para: slashcommand& reference to self for chaining of calls

briefdescription.para: Set whether the command should be age-restricted or not.

parameterdescription.para: true if the command should be age-restricted

simplesect.para: slashcommand& reference to self for chaining of calls

briefdescription.para: Set the default permissions of the slash command.

parameterdescription.para: default permissions to set. This is a permission bitmask of bits from dpp::permissions

simplesect.para: You can set it to 0 to disable the command for everyone except admins by default
slashcommand& reference to self for chaining of calls

briefdescription.para: Add an option (parameter)

simplesect.para: slashcommand& reference to self for chaining of calls

briefdescription.para: Set the type of the slash command (only for context menu entries)

parameterdescription.para: Type of context menu entry this command represents

simplesect.para: If the type is dpp::ctxm_chat_input, the command name will be set to lowercase.
slashcommand& reference to self for chaining of calls

briefdescription.para: Set the name of the command.

simplesect.para: The maximum length of a command name is 32 UTF-8 codepoints. If your command name is longer than this, it will be truncated. The command name will be set to lowercase when the type is the default dpp::ctxm_chat_input.
slashcommand& reference to self for chaining of calls

briefdescription.para: Set the description of the command.

simplesect.para: The maximum length of a command description is 100 UTF-8 codepoints. If your command description is longer than this, it will be truncated.
slashcommand& reference to self for chaining of calls

briefdescription.para: Set the application id of the command.

simplesect.para: slashcommand& reference to self for chaining of calls

briefdescription.para: Adds a permission to the command.

simplesect.para: slashcommand& reference to self for chaining of calls

xrefdescription.para: Discord discourage use of this value and instead you should use default_member_permissions.

briefdescription.para: Disable default permissions, command will be unusable unless permissions are overridden with add_permission and dpp::guild_command_edit_permissions.

simplesect.para: slashcommand& reference to self for chaining of calls

xrefdescription.para: Discord discourage use of this value and instead you should use default_member_permissions.

briefdescription.para: Return a ping/mention for the slash command.

simplesect.para: std::string mention. e.g. </airhorn:816437322781949972>
If you want a mention for a subcommand or subcommand group, you can use dpp::utility::slashcommand_mention

briefdescription.para: Get the creation time of this object according to Discord.

simplesect.para: double creation time inferred from the snowflake ID. The minimum possible value is the first second of 2015.

briefdescription.para: Comparison operator for comparing two managed objects by id.

simplesect.para: true objects are the same id
false objects are not the same id

briefdescription.para: Comparison operator for comparing two managed objects by id.

simplesect.para: true objects are not the same id
false objects are the same id

briefdescription.para: Convert object from nlohmann::json.

simplesect.para: T& Reference to self for fluent calling

briefdescription.para: Convert object to nlohmann::json.

parameterdescription.para: Whether to include the ID or not

simplesect.para: Some fields are conditionally filled, do not rely on all fields being present
json Json built from the structure

briefdescription.para: Convert object to json string.

parameterdescription.para: Whether to include the ID or not

simplesect.para: Some fields are conditionally filled, do not rely on all fields being present
std::string Json built from the structure

briefdescription.para: Represents an application command, created by your bot either globally, or on a guild.
